text:
Created attachment 34279
GET parameter with chinese character NOT url encoded

ONE. How It happens
when JM as a proxy to do record, the browser issue a GET, with a parameter, whose value is simplified chinese character and NOT url encoded. JM will throw Exception and interupt you to go on.

TWO. Please replay it
I do not have the environment when writing this bug. But I can show u in another way.
1. prepare HTTP request in raw so charles not do url encoded automatically
2. use charles to issue the HTTP request to JM proxy listening port 8889.
3. see JM throw Exception

THREE. charles Version is V3.11.5

FOUR. Is it a bug?
I think it's a bug. for even there is a rule that simplified chinese character should be url encoded in URL, but if u do not follow the rule,
1. browser act normally ok with no proxy.
2. browser act normally ok with proxy of Charlse
3. browser act NOT ok with proxy of JM

plz check the pic & u will see.
creator: hppyhjh@163.com

text:
Hello,
Would it be possible to provide some public URL to a website using simplified chinese character ?
Thank you
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
Or maybe you can provide a simple JMX file containing your request with Chinese characters.
Thanks
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
Without further information , we cannot work on this issue.
So closing as INVALID.
Feel free to reopen with required information.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
